quest.name: Annihilation
journal: A solid plan of action must be devised before facing the Bangaa transformed.

A preliminary examination of the lighthouse's exterior has led Ramza to conclude that the structure was built atop the ruins of an ancient metropolis known as the Clockwork City of Goug. Further investigation of the tower's interior is necessary to put the matter beyond doubt.

※The Ridorana Lighthouse can be accessed via the Duty Finder.
With Yiazmat defeated and Ba'Gamnan's soul returned to the aether, the secrets of the Ridorana Lighthouse have revealed themselves to you and your companions.
Back aboard the Prima Vista, Bwagi reveals that a necklace discovered by Ramza at the scene of the battle with Ba'Gamnan once belonged to the late Princess Ashelia of Dalmasca.

After your discoveries in Lesalia and now Goug, Lina Mewrilah questions whether you do not already have enough evidence to prove that Ivalice is more than a mere faerie tale. However, she understands that Principal Jenomis and his ever more temperamental son will not stop until they have cleared their family's name.
objectives: Speak with Lina Mewrilah at Kugane Landing.

dialogue.name: JENOMISLEXENTALE
dialogue.text: Much as I wish it were otherwise...I fear Ba'Gamnan is beyond saving. Yet we cannot suffer what is left of him to become a distraction.

dialogue.name: ALMALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: Father. Is now not the time to abandon this quest? We are meddling with forces beyond─

dialogue.name: RAMZALEXENTALE
dialogue.text:
Enough, Alma. We adults are talking.
While Forename was searching for the lizard, I inspected an area of exposed foundation at the base of the lighthouse.

dialogue.name: JENOMISLEXENTALE
dialogue.text: And?

dialogue.name: RAMZALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: And you were right, Father! The lighthouse is built squarely atop the ruins of what can only be...the Clockwork City of Goug!

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: The what-work city of who?

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: According to the Zodiac Brave Story, the Clockwork City of Goug was a metallic metropolis wherein airships, automata, and other technological marvels of the age were first conceived. Little is said about its location, however, save that it was far away.

dialogue.name: JENOMISLEXENTALE
dialogue.text: While the Durai Papers do not say a great deal more, they do mention that the land upon which the legendary city was built was severely limited─an inconvenience that forced its inhabitants to build up, rather than out.

dialogue.name: JENOMISLEXENTALE
dialogue.text: Which led me to ask myself: what if the reason land was limited was because the land in question was an island?

dialogue.name: JENOMISLEXENTALE
dialogue.text: But that still would not explain the omission of the cataract. It is inconceivable that the authors would neglect to mention so prominent a landmark had it existed. And then I found it─a lone passage regarding Goug's fall. While the particulars were missing, it appears the city was abandoned after an explosion left half of it in ruin.

dialogue.name: JENOMISLEXENTALE
dialogue.text: I believe that this explosion may have undermined a portion of the seabed. It need only have been a small area at first─one that could well have gone unnoticed during the exodus. As time passed, however, the waters would have continued to wear away at the rock, slowly widening the gap until...

dialogue.name: JENOMISLEXENTALE
dialogue.text: Well, until we have what lies beneath us today. This would explain why there is no mention of Ridorana prior to the present era.

dialogue.name: RAMZALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: ...Come, Father─will you not tell them the rest? Of the possibility that we Garleans are descended in part from the displaced citizens of Goug?

dialogue.name: RAMZALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: It would explain how the Empire was able to forge its armies of iron even before the discovery and application of Allagan technology.

dialogue.name: RAMZALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: And it may also explain why the legend of Ivalice has resonated with our people for centuries, despite the fact that the lost kingdom was, as far as we can tell, in quite a different corner of the world.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: An interesting...if somewhat ambitious theory. But to return to your original claim, it is your belief that the Ridorana Lighthouse stands atop what is left of─

dialogue.name: BWAGI
dialogue.text: That necklace! Where did you get it, girl?

dialogue.name: ALMALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: Th-This? It was my mother's.

dialogue.name: BWAGI
dialogue.text: Your mother's?

dialogue.name: JENOMISLEXENTALE
dialogue.text: It was my late wife's most cherished possession. Why do you ask?

dialogue.name: BWAGI
dialogue.text: Ba'Gamnan had a talisman he would wear beneath his jerkin. He refused to take it off, even when bathing. He said it was...special. I only saw it a few times, but it looked exactly like the one your daughter wears.

dialogue.name: RAMZALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: And? What are you implying, lizard? That my sister stole it? Or my late mother!?

dialogue.name: BWAGI
dialogue.text: Neither. I spoke of their similarity. That is all.

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: Can you believe the nerve of this boy?

dialogue.name: JENOMISLEXENTALE
dialogue.text: Enough, Ramza. Our guests are merely concerned for the well-being of their kin.

dialogue.name: RAMZALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: But what of our kin!?

dialogue.name: JENOMISLEXENTALE
dialogue.text: What of them, Ramza!? Do you imagine our kin to be better than theirs in some way? Or anyone else's for that matter!?

dialogue.name: RAMZALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: I...I apologize, Father.

dialogue.name: JENOMISLEXENTALE
dialogue.text: We have but one purpose, son, and that is to prove the existence of Ivalice and clear our family's name. Do not allow anger or hate to lead you from that path. Now, we have a lost city to explore!

dialogue.name: RAMZALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: Mother's necklace... But what is it doing here? Unless─

dialogue.name: RAMZALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: Alma? Alma, are you there?

dialogue.name: ALMALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: I'm here, Ramza.

dialogue.name: JENOMISLEXENTALE
dialogue.text: Extraordinary. The stones are different, but the craftsmanship is identical. However did it come to be in Ba'Gamnan's possession?

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Hmm...though they are indeed of a different shape, the stones appear to be cut from the same crystal.

dialogue.name: MONTBLANC
dialogue.text: Oh, they are. Auracite.

dialogue.name: JENOMISLEXENTALE
dialogue.text: Auracite? And what makes you say that?

dialogue.name: MONTBLANC
dialogue.text: Can't you feel it? You can feel it, can't you, Hurdy.

dialogue.name: BWAGI
dialogue.text: Do you recall me telling you that Ba'Gamnan considered the necklace special?

dialogue.name: BWAGI
dialogue.text: It was special because it was entrusted to him by Prince Rasler. He was to return it to Princess Ashelia upon delivering Her Highness from Nalbina Fortress.

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: A family keepsake.

dialogue.name: JENOMISLEXENTALE
dialogue.text: Of course! And each necklace─each auracite─has acted as a lodestone, drawing both of our parties closer and closer to Ivalice.

dialogue.name: RAMZALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: Indeed, Father. The auracite guides us.

dialogue.name: ALMALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: Ramza! Are you recovered?

dialogue.name: RAMZALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: Thank you, Sister. I am well now.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: From what we know of the Duma and the Otius, vestiges of one's will may endure in an auracite. Could it be, then, that the desire of the former owner─or creator─of these necklaces was simply to...return to Ivalice?

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: But who could that have been?

dialogue.name: RAMZALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: Ramza. Ramza Beoulve. He wanted people to return to his homeland and uncover the truth behind the kingdom's founding!

dialogue.name: RAMZALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: But then why show us Lesalia and Goug, you ask.

dialogue.name: RAMZALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: Simple. We are being tested. The auracite is measuring our worth─seeing if we are deserving of that truth.

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: You say these things as if you knew them. But how could you? Nothing we have uncovered suggests anything of the kind.

dialogue.name: RAMZALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: I know you have your doubts, but I can assure you they are misplaced. For now, I must ask you to trust me, Lady Mewrilah.

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: Lady Mewrilah? Since when did you─

dialogue.name: ALMALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: Ramza, are you feeling quite yourself?

dialogue.name: RAMZALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: Of course I am, Sister dearest. I have never felt better!

dialogue.name: MONTBLANC
dialogue.text: I sense a disturbance in the aether...

dialogue.name: RAMZALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: Father. These necklaces are gifts. Gifts from the old gods who once watched over the Ivalicians. It is proof we have their blessing! With the necklaces and the Otius, we can finally prove─

dialogue.name: RAMZALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: Thank you, Forename. I know not what came over me...

dialogue.name: ALMALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: Ramza, you must rest.

dialogue.name: RAMZALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: Leave me be, Alma. Did I not tell you I'll be fine?

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: Another adventure under our belts, eh, Forename? I'd best put pen to page before the details fade.

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: Lesalia...and now Goug. One would think our discoveries more than sufficient to prove the Lexentales' claims, at least with regard to Ivalice's existence.

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: But something tells me that until Jenomis has proof that his ancestors were not the heretics the church painted them to be, he will not rest.

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: And then there is the curious case of Ramza. At Alma's throat one moment, all “sister dearest” the next.

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: He was like a different person when he came to, yet I seem to be alone in wondering exactly what happened to him back at the lighthouse. If you ask this “Lady,” he must have taken quite some bump to the head when he fell.

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: Then again, it didn't take him long to turn back into his spiteful little self, so...all's well that ends well?
